page.title: 10Newcastle Higher Education
page.content: {Newcastle University}was given its own charter in 1963,although the{ {Medical School}is now 150 years old. Situated in the city centre itself, the university offers a wide range of subjects to its 8000 students. It has a large{Dentistry {School,}and strong subjects include Medicine, Naval Architecture and Law. The modern{Polytechnic,}built on the old Sandiford inner city terraces is known for Engineering and Fashion Design. North of the city centre are three {Public Schools,}The Royal Grammar School for boys, the G.P.D.S.T.Central High and the Church High School for girls.{Local Authority Schools}are outside the city centre, with the exception of local Primary Schools. There is a{specialist school}for deaf children in Jesmond.
